name: The Grosvenor Plymouth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: My sister and I stayed at the Grosvenor for 2 nights, 17th, 18th of May. Nicely situated though parking can be a bit difficult. The decor and furnishings were very good and the bed was comfortable. Very good TV with many channels and good Wi-Fi signal. The en-suite was good. The hotel was immaculately clean. The breakfast was excellent.
reviews.title: Very Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked 6 nights in the Superior room and was not disappointed. Clean, spacious,comfortable with lots of storage. King size bed was very comfortable and linen , towels provided were of a good quality.
reviews.title: GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was plentiful and of a good quality and service was second to none.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel, Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were pleasant and very accommodating.
reviews.title: Great overnight really enjoyed our short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only minor drawback was carparking. There are approx six spaces to the rear with a long walk around with heavy luggage or to pay $3.00 per day with a concessionary ticket. However, in high season car parking spaces wil be of a premium.
reviews.title: Absolutely spot-on

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: My 13 year old daughter and myself stayed at the Grosvenor for one night and found the service excellent. The staff were very friendly and offered us the family room which gave us a bit more space. The hotel was not far from the Barbican where we were visiting for the evening, which made walking there very easy. The beds were very comfortable, and the room was nice and warm. The bathroom had all the usuals, shampoo, shower gel etc and everything was very clean. The breakfast in the morning was excellent and had a good range to choose from, including a vegetarian option. We would definately stay here again if visiting Plymouth.
reviews.title: The Grosvenor is a friendly, clean and comfortable hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for two nights for a big party nearby and were amongst several other couples staying there. Without exception, everyone had nothing but praise, the staff were very friendly and informative and the breakfasts were freshly cooked to order.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, value for money and good rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We had a superior room and it was very clean and spacious.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: On the whole, we would heartily recommend this hotel. We are experienced travellers and this small hotel exceeded expectations.
reviews.title: Best in the west

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Modern clean rooms, great friendly service, brilliant location, great value for money, definatly returning
reviews.title: Close to all amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 nights over the Easter holiday and can honestly say it was a pleasure. We had a superior room which was amply big enough for us two. The shower was amazing! Would not hesitate to recommend this for location/freindliness of staff etc. Sarah & Mike were particularly lovely.
reviews.title: Lovley Hotel, brilliant location, freindly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: It was a lovely place to stay. The staff go out of their way to help you. Mike and Sarah are fantastic as hosts. I am fairly local (Torquay) so know my way around Plymouth but I noticed that guests who were not familiar with the area were given a whole rundown of where to go and what was on and if they needed more info just ask. It was very clean and tidy. The breakfast was lovely, lots of choice. Help yourself to tea, coffee, juice, milk, cereal and fruits, then you can also have a full English. I would not hesitate in recommending it. It is also right on the doorstep to the Hoe so is a beautiful view for a 30 second walk
reviews.title: OUTSTANDING

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: We had a superior room. Wasn't all that big but was nicely furnished. Great location. Short walk to the sea and into town. Very friendly reception staff. Breakfast was good quality. Lots of stairs to our room so I would mention on your booking if you cannot manage lots of stair. Reasonable price for what you get. We enjoyed our stay and I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Great location, perfect for a city stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very impressed with the Grosvenor, so much so that I was delighted to encourage my mum to stay there later that week!
reviews.title: Perfect for a quiet weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The welcome at the door was friendly, helpful, and personal.
reviews.title: High Quality Value Business Friendly Gem in the Hoe Plymouth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Very clean, modern, friendly. We stayed 1 night in the family suite which consisted of 2 bedrooms (1 double bed and 3 singles). Beds were very comfortable, quality of furniture etc was excellent + all the little extra touches that you find in the more expensive corporate hotels. Breakfast was spot on, good quality food - well presented and served by pleasant staff. Even the bar was reasonably priced. Hotel is well located for tourists, a stone's throw from the 'Hoe'. I appreciate that parking could be an issue but personally I managed to park outside with no problem and at a cost of £3. There were spaces offered in the Hotel car park but after a long drive I couldn't be bothered to move the car.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel - highly recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Ive stopped here whilst travelling alone on business on more than one occasion. The price is great. The location is in the city & on the doorstep of the Hoe. The room is always clean. Staff are really friendly and breakfast is nice. It also has a descent enough TV with cable channels. Only downside is limited parking & it would be nice if they provided evening meals, although I'm told this is due to happen soon.
reviews.title: calling all business travellers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Very nice up to date accomodation, short walk from the magnificent Plymouth Hoe and views of the harbour - i also walked along the Hoe and down to the Barbican for a drink at the Bar at the Plymouth gin distillery which made for a great end to the day
reviews.title: Great spot and Great Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice breakfast with tasty sausages and toast especially
reviews.title: A very comfortable little hotel and incredibly helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Plymouth is a busy place and its hard to find a good hotel at a reasonable price. Having used Trip Advisor to find the Grosvenor, we were very happy to arrive, tired and late in the evening, to the most friendly and helpful staff you could ever find and a small but extremely comfortable room. Although there are no lifts, the staff are happy to carry heavy bags for you. I got the impression that the staff would do anything they could to help, you just had to ask.
reviews.title: Very comfortable

description: Situated in the southwest's largest city, the Grosvenor Plymouth is the ideal base for a quality and affordable stay in the historical city of Plymouth.
